title: Bering Land Bridge National Preserve: Alaskan Hare
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Land Mammals     Alaskan Hare                Alaskan Hare          Living primarily in open tundra, the Alaskan hare is well adapted to avoiding predators. It grows large, weighing three times more than the snowshoe hare, helping it to deter attacking animals. Its fur changes color from winter white to summer red-brown, keeping the hare camouflaged year-round. This fur also helps It survives the harsh cold of its home. People have trapped the hare for centuries for this light, warm fur, using it for winter parkas and other clothing.
